title: How to Make Tarka Dal

steps.headline: Prepare the lentils.
Chop the onion and garlic.
steps.description: Cut the ends off a medium onion, and chop finely. Crush 2 cloves of garlic, remove the skin, and chop them finely.

steps.headline: Spice the butter.
steps.description: Over a medium heat, melt 30g of butter in a non-stick frying pan. Then, add 1/4 teaspoon of cumin seeds, and about a 1/4 teaspoon of asafoetida.

steps.headline: Add onions and garlic.
steps.description: Add the chopped onion and garlic to the frying pan, and fry until the onion starts to brown. This will take about 6 minutes.

steps.headline: Add more spice.
steps.description: Sprinkle in 1/4 teaspoon of chilli powder and desired amount of salt. Keep stirring.

steps.headline: Add the Lentils.
steps.description: Add the boiled lentils to the pan and keep frying for another 3-4 minutes. The lentils will absorb the flavours of the butter and spices.

steps.headline: Add Garam Masala to give it a more spicy look.
steps.description: Add half a teaspoon of Garam Masala, and stir. Take the pan off the heat.

steps.headline: Serve it and enjoy.
steps.description: Top the dal with a knob of butter, and scatter some fresh chopped coriander leaves to garnish.

text:
Prepare the lentils. Put 300g of red dal into a sieve, and rinse with cold water under a tap, until the water runs almost clear. Bring 850ml of water to the boil in a non-stick pan, and add the lentils. {"smallUrl":"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/6/6c/Make-Tarka-Dal-Step-1Bullet1.jpg/v4-459px-Make-Tarka-Dal-Step-1Bullet1.jpg","bigUrl":"/images/thumb/6/6c/Make-Tarka-Dal-Step-1Bullet1.jpg/aid524042-v4-728px-Make-Tarka-Dal-Step-1Bullet1.jpg","smallWidth":460,"smallHeight":306,"bigWidth":"728","bigHeight":"485","licensing":"

License: Creative Commons


"} Immediately, add a teaspoon of turmeric and 1/4 teaspoon of ground coriander. Stir, then leave to bubble gently for 15 to 20 minutes, until the lentils are soft, and the water is frothy. Stir occasionally. {"smallUrl":"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/2/25/Make-Tarka-Dal-Step-1Bullet2.jpg/v4-459px-Make-Tarka-Dal-Step-1Bullet2.jpg","bigUrl":"/images/thumb/2/25/Make-Tarka-Dal-Step-1Bullet2.jpg/aid524042-v4-728px-Make-Tarka-Dal-Step-1Bullet2.jpg","smallWidth":460,"smallHeight":306,"bigWidth":"728","bigHeight":"485","licensing":"

License: Creative Commons


"} Chop the onion and garlic. Cut the ends off a medium onion, and chop finely. Crush 2 cloves of garlic, remove the skin, and chop them finely. Spice the butter. Over a medium heat, melt 30g of butter in a non-stick frying pan. Then, add 1/4 teaspoon of cumin seeds, and about a 1/4 teaspoon of asafoetida. Add onions and garlic. Add the chopped onion and garlic to the frying pan, and fry until the onion starts to brown. This will take about 6 minutes. Add more spice. Sprinkle in 1/4 teaspoon of chilli powder and desired amount of salt. Keep stirring. Add the Lentils. Add the boiled lentils to the pan and keep frying for another 3-4 minutes. The lentils will absorb the flavours of the butter and spices. Add Garam Masala to give it a more spicy look. Add half a teaspoon of Garam Masala, and stir. Take the pan off the heat. Serve it and enjoy. Top the dal with a knob of butter, and scatter some fresh chopped coriander leaves to garnish. Finished.
